class_notes: Pre-requisite Note: EPI, GLEPI, EH-EPI, and EPI PHD only through March 28th.  This course is participating in a pilot of the "waitlist" feature in OPUS.  If this course is full and you would like to be placed on the waitlist for automatic enrollment, select waitlist.  If there would be a course conflict should a spot become available, use the "swap" feature in OPUS for the course that is a time conflict.  The waitlist will be removed at 12:00am on August 30.  Should any seats become available after that time and date, students may add the course.  Additional information on waitlist may be found here for RSPH students: https://canvas.emory.edu/courses/74719/pages/waitlist.
course_description: Prerequisite: EPI 504 or EPI 530 and BIOS 500.  This course presents issues in women of being female but not pathologies of reproduction. These include cardiovascular disease, osteoporosis, and breast and cervical cancer. In addition, health problems related to the physiological and psychological aspects of being female are addressed. These include depression, premenstrual syndrome, addictive behavior, and violence perpetrated by and against women.
